quote: “Do not allow anything to stop you from the pursuit of your dreams.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Doubt is a disease.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Praise is a perpetual prosperity.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “If we humble ourselves, God will lift us high.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “There is no rejection, there is only redirection. You can have everything and feel nothing.”
Author: Matt Haig,

quote: “Work harder; not smarter.”
Author: Joseph Perry Grassi,

quote: “Rank comes with responsibility whether you’re ready or not”
Author: Joseph Perry Grassi,

quote: “Without love, life is without light.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “God your word is lamp to guide me.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Kids highlight your faults.”
Author: Rasmee Yasin,

quote: “Light should be shared not compressed.”
Author: Rasmee Yasin,

quote: “Private, everything is mind over matter, If you don’t mind, it don’t matter.”
Author: Joseph Perry Grassi,

quote: “Private, everything is mind over matter. If you don’t mind, it don’t matter.”
Author: Joseph Perry Grassi,

quote: “So my advice to you is, do what makes you happy. Stop thinking about others and focus on yourself. Only then the impossible becomes the possible' she said.”
Author: Anar T. Rzayev,

quote: “What you seek is seeking you.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Do not waste your life, do some useful work.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Praise is a prevailing petition.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Do not give in to defeat, try again.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “The lamp shows in the darkness that you cannot see in the light of day".”
Author: Fahim Khan

quote: “Sometimes you might feel that the people around you doesn't worth to have a hero, but still be..because you are..!”
Author: Mahendar Singh Jakhar

quote: “Never give-up on yourself when you have a bad day, and somebody will not give up on you.”
Author: Mahendar Singh Jakhar

quote: “Luck is waiting for you around the corner, enough thinking, start walking towards it now.”
Author: Kalpesh Jain

quote: “Now is definitely the best time to start, though Yesterday would have beaten it easily.”
Author: Kalpesh Jain

quote: “To find what you're looking for in a cluttered room, you may have to organize the whole room. You may have to give time to the things that you're not looking for. No effort goes waste. Everything is connected.”
Author: Shunya

quote: “The Universe knows everything about you, and will bring to you, either what matches you, or even better than what you may expect. You cannot just dream yourself to what you want; you have to work on it, for the Universe puts the possibilities in front of you, while it is your job to notice it and do something about it.”
Author: Gino DiCaprio,

quote: “You become what your thoughts envision. Therefore, you create what your life will be. You are each, your own Creator, and no one can create for you what you want or do not want. That is unless you give up your power to them. Do you comprehend this?
Author: Gino DiCaprio,

quote: “Search deeply with your soul, you find the strength to overcome any situation.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Search deeply within your soul, you will find the strength to overcome any situation.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “I don't have wishes, I make plans”
Author: shruthi laya

quote: “Why seek help, where there is no help?”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Moral wisdom delivers a man from wrongdoing.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “People must purpose to pray.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “A life of surrender, giving up control, was the simplest solution to living a peaceful life.”
Author: Aarti Raheja,

quote: “Sadness is a healing emotion. It is a drug. It puts us in a calmer state. If we embrace sadness properly, we will be in a cosy state rather than in pain.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “I pledge allegiance to the Lord Jesus Christ, my Saviour.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Without a peace of mind, how could the people have a healthy body?”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “The fact that life throws anything at you is a great way to knowing you can become anything.”
Author: Samuel Clément

quote: “There is hardly any element that contains the same vigor as our emotions do. Embark on a journey of spirituality and self-growth by embracing your emotions.”
Author: Alyaa Sadek,

quote: “You are part of the universe after all – at times, you are in control; other times, you are bound to let go and flow by witnessing the magic of this world, that’s part of being alive.”
Author: Alyaa Sadek,

quote: “If you want to learn something, then make mistakes or ask someone. I think both are the best ways to learn.”
Author: Zeeshan Ali

quote: “When a man sets his heart to a fulfil his mission with all his might, invisible forces comes to his aid.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Positive attitude towards your goal can lead you to success.”
Author: Brajesh Kumar Singh

quote: “Everyone has a side you do not know, just like even you have a side that you do not know yet.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “Make peace your standard emotion. Make it the home of your mind. Live in peace.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “For a successful life, you should have to learn from your past. Think the mistakes you've made in the past, but learn from that instead of regret.”
Author: Zeeshan Ali

quote: “Growth is nothing more than transforming your imperfections into strengths.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “You have limited amount of moments in which you are alive.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “This is how far the Lord has helped us. Still firm faith in the LORD God, we lead us forward.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Joy is a good state to be in. But it is not a life target to be joyful. It is not an aim. It does not exist in the end.It exists now.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “Let the past be your wisdom. Let the future be your intention. Let the present be your life.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “Confidence receives attention. It invites attention. Because confidence is when a person is not afraid of attention but rather welcomes it with open arms.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “Uniqueness is an attribute of people who choose to live life on their own terms.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “When we feel anger and we use it well, that gives us huge dignity. When we feel fear and we use it well, it saves our lives. When we feel shame and we use it well, it gives us humility.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “When your time comes to leave this life, make sure not to regret the things you have not done.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “We transform instantly as soon as the purpose speaks louder than the ego.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “You are a part of a universal balance. Everything that is out of your control happens in a way that you will become an important part of this balance.”
Author: Ozan Kulcu,

quote: “Be yourself and embrace the moment, even if others rejected you." - Avocado the Turtle”
Author: Kiara Shankar,

quote: “What does it take to love? I pondered.
Author: Aarti Raheja,

quote: “A man's only aim is to live in fulfilment of his mission.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “The things you allow to control your mind will also control your perception of reality”
Author: Constance Friday

quote: “We always fail when we try,
Author: Nikhil  Sharda

quote: “The creator provides food for all his creation.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “When one’s wealth is lost, his friends, his wife, his servants, and his relations, all forsake him; and when wealth is regained, then all those who had forsaken him, come back; therefore, in this world, wealth is the only true friend and relative.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Sinfully acquired money stays for ten years; in the eleventh year, it is completely destroyed along with the principal amount.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “An unsuitable object in the hands of a capable person becomes suitable, while a suitable object in the hands of an incapable person becomes unsuitable.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A jewel rolls on the feet, a glass on the head is kept, but at buying-selling time, a glass is a glass, and a jewel is a jewel.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Endless are the scriptures, too vast is knowledge, limited is time, and many are the obstacles; thus the essence should be taken, like a swan takes out the milk from water.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Even if a sandalwood is cut, it does not forsake its fragrance; even if an elephant grows old, it does not forsake its sportiveness; even if a sugarcane is squeezed in a mill, it does not forsake its sweetness; likewise, even if reduced to abject poverty, a man of noble lineage does not forsake his noble qualities.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Who after receiving wealth is not proud? Which licentious person’s calamities have ended? Whose heart women have not shattered on this earth? Who is always loved by the king? Who has not suffered the ravages of time? Which beggar has attained glory? Who has skilfully walked the worldly path after falling in the evil of evil persons?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In a man of discrimination, merits acquire the desired recognition; in gold when a gem is set, it sparkles most appropriately.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In wealth, in living life, in women, and in eating, all beings have remained unsatisfied; so have they gone and so will they go.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “By offering loving sentences, all beings are satisfied; thus, such sentences only should be spoken; in speech why should one be miserly?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The worldly poisonous tree has only two nectar-like fruits; well-spoken words and the delicious company of cultured people.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The person whose knowledge is confined to books, and whose wealth is in the control of others; in times of need finds his knowledge as no knowledge and his wealth as no wealth.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Which vice can be worse than greed? What can be more sinful than slander? For a truthful person, wherein is the need for austerity? For a person with a pure heart, wherein is the need for a pilgrimage? For a person who gives and gets respect from others, wherein is the need for acquiring other virtue? For a man decorated with fame, of what value is other ornamentation? For a man having true knowledge, wherein is the need for wealth? For a man dishonoured, what could be worse in death?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “When a man is devoid of strength, he becomes an ascetic; when a man is without wealth, he behaves like a celibate; when a man is sick, he becomes a devotee of god; and when a woman grows old, she becomes faithful to her husband.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The snake has poison in its fang, the fly on its head, the scorpion in its tail, but an evil person is poisonous in all parts.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In whose heart the desire to benefit others is always active; his troubles are destroyed and he receives wealth at each step.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “If the beloved is there, if wealth is present, if the son is filled with good qualities, and if a grandson is born, then what does heaven, the city of gods, have more than this?”
Author: Rajen Jani

quote: “Food, sleep, fear, and sexual intercourse, is common in man and animals; knowledge is the extra that makes a man special, without which he is similar to an animal.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Why are you looking down O woman? What of yours has fallen on the ground? Oh! Oh! Fool! don’t you know, lost is my youth’s jewel!”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Life is misery without music.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Our dwelling place is a place of prayer.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “There is nothing that educates a man better than his experience.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Do not be stubborn, give up your sins, repent.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “The ears enjoys hearing words.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Hold fast to firm faith.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Find your way in the world.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Keep calm in crisis.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Stand firm in the storm.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Pray always pray.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Always, remember that you are a mortal being.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “A cloth seller is wandering from street to street. It’s evening, still no sales. It feels like he is walking through a desert, dying to get a drop of water, dying to make a sale. He is frustrated now. He gets angry at a customer who actually wanted to buy a lot of clothes from him.
Author: Shunya

quote: “Big elephants get stuck in small pits. Don’t lose your self-confidence when petty problems of life overwhelm you. You’re the big elephant.”
Author: Shunya

quote: “The very centre of your heart is where life begins - the most beautiful place on earth.”
Author: RUMI

quote: “There is no place like a place of prayer.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “...life is a war we all lose in the end, but every day is a battle, and you can sure as hell win some of those.”
Author: Tom B. Night,

quote: “But the surest way to live a worthwhile, meaningful life was to have already done so, those moments etched forever into the fabric of spacetime.”
Author: Tom B. Night,

quote: “There is no ONE reason why people fail as People fail when they are not empowered to win.
Author: Lyssa-ann Clarke

quote: “Fixing problems is like breaking a pencil. It's very hard to break many pencils at one time; however, if you try breaking one at a time it's very easy to do.”
Author: James Thomas Kesterson Jr

quote: “This crisis calls for a change.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “The promises of God shall be fulfilled in the perfect time.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “With prayerful faith in the spirit of persistence, we shall behold the promises of God.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Praying leads to then practice of piety.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “My heart trust in God, thereof, I am helped.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Do not resent the righteous God, when He rebukes you.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “There is no place like a place of payer.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Praying leads to the practice of piety.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “God with me, He is mighty to save.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “When you fall, do not stay down, look for the strength within to rise.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Take chances, make mistakes and, get messy!”
Author: Ms. Frizzle

quote: “Faith in the LORD God is the only certainty of life.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Oil on water, a secret shared with an evil person, a donation given to a worthy recipient, and scriptures in the possession of an aware person; these on their own gain expansion, due to their inherent strengths.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Although far, yet not far is the one who in the mind resides; but one who is not in the heart, although near, yet is far”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “From whom something dear is desired, to that person always speak dearly; the hunter kills the deer by songs sung melodiously.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “He lives, who has merits; who has righteousness, he lives; devoid of merits or righteousness, living is useless.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “According to the occasion witnessed, should be the speech; according to the glory seen, should be the dearness; according to one’s strength, should be the anger; one who knows this is a knowledgeable man.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Righteousness, wealth, grains, words of a Guru, and medicines, should be well-preserved, otherwise you cannot survive.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Discard evil company, cultivate good people’s association; undertake virtue day and night, remember the certainty of uncertainity.”
Author: Rajen Jani

quote: “One who gives the knowledge of even a single letter, is a Guru; the student is one who fully understands it; in this world there is no substance that the student can give to repay his debt to his Guru.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Wicked people and thorns, in two ways can be counteracted; either with the shoe smash their faces, or from afar discard them.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One who wears dirty clothes, one who has dirty teeth, one who eats too much, one who speaks cruelly, one who sleeps after sunrise or before sunset, is discarded by Shree, the goddess of wealth, although he may be the discus-bearer, the god Vishnu himself.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Whatever happened in the past brought you to this point in life. If you are sad at this point, you will say, “It happened for bad.” If you are happy at this point, you will say, “It happened for good.”
Author: Shunya

quote: “Success is like a high profile person and “Struggle” is her grumpy secretary who doesn’t let you meet her easily. When you befriend “Success”, when you become worthy of her friendship, you can meet her directly.”
Author: Shunya

quote: “You lock your house and go out for a week. When you return, everything seems strange inside the house. The house grows in your absence! Everything in the universe is sitting on Time and continuously growing, with or without you.
Author: Shunya

quote: “For a migratory bird, there is one supreme truth, “Sky is the freedom.” If it enters into a room by accident, it tries to get out by flying upward. It keeps banging its head against the ceiling. It fails to find the door or windows because it firmly believes that freedom is upward, not sideways.
Author: Shunya

quote: “Again wealth, again a friend, again a wife, again a kingdom; these all can be gained again, but a human body cannot be gained again and again.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “If the king is righteous then the subjects are also righteous, if the king is wicked then the subjects are also wicked, if the king is equally righteous and wicked, then the subjects are also equally righteous and wicked, the subjects behave according to the behaviour of the king, as the king is, likewise are the subjects.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Although apparently alive but devoid of righteousness, to me that person is dead; and although dead but was filled with righteousness, that person lives long, without doubt.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The hearts of low men burn with jealous fire upon seeing the fame of others; unable to reach the famed status of others, they start to slander the famous others.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Bondage is a mind that is attached to objects, and freedom is a mind that is unattached to objects; the mind is the cause for human bondage or freedom.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Who obtains all happiness as desired by the heart? In God’s control is everything; therefore, contentment is the refuge.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “As in a thousand cows, a calf goes towards its mother; likewise, a performed act goes towards its doer.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One who has no stability in his work, is not happy either in society or in a forest; the society burns him with social gatherings, and the forest burns him with the lack of society.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “According to the work the result is obtained, and intelligence also follows work; therefore, discerning persons undertake only such work, which is well-thought out in details.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In this world there are only three jewels: water, food, and sweet speech; fools consider pieces of rocks as jewels.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “From the tree of crimes committed by oneself, comes forth fruits in the body as poverty, sorrow, disease, bondage, and affliction.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Prior to the arrival of the expected problem, one who applies various solutions to solve it; and when an unexpected problem arrives, one who can apply its correct solution immediately; both of these persons progress happily; but the fatalist is destroyed, as he does nothing and simply leaves everything to fate.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Large numbers can unitedly overcome an enemy; the rainfall holding cloud by a large number of grass-blades is overcome.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Faith is a fierce fire.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Let's ride hard towards your goal.”
Author: Brajesh Kumar Singh

quote: “Children are full of courage.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “I never forgot who Queena was before the attack, but she was so different now that it almost felt like I had a third child.”
Author: Vanna Nguyen,

quote: “Our existence on earth is for our enjoyment.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Do not be stubborn, repent of your sins.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Gods, good men, and one’s father, are satisfied by one’s nature; relatives are satisfied with hospitality of a bath, food, and drink; whereas, scholars are satisfied when asked to give discourse.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “This attachment only is fearful, this attachment only causes sorrow, attachment is the root of sorrow, one who discards attachment becomes happy.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Oh! Say how strange is the nature of great-souled people! They consider wealth as light as a straw; however, under its weight they humbly bend down in salutation!”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Without peace, there is no progress.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Why should you be stubborn? Stop living sinful lives.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Life-span, work, wealth, knowledge, and death; these five are created when inside the womb resides the body.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Hard storms make great sailors”
Author: Chaker Khazaal,

quote: “A Brahmin is like a tree, whose roots are the evening prayers, whose branches are the Vedas, and whose righteous acts are the leaves; hence, the root should be carefully protected, for if the root is torn, then there will be no branches and no leaves.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In a single tree reside various coloured birds, who at dawn fly off in ten different directions; in this what is there to grieve?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The intelligent is strong, how can the unintelligent be strong? In the jungle, the lion in his arrogant madness was killed by the jackal.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “What worry have I for my maintenance, if Hari Vishvambhara is the supporter of all? If this were not so, then for supporting the life of the baby, how would the mother’s breasts be filled with milk? Thinking this every moment, O lord of the Yadus, O husband of Lakshmi, only your lotus feet I serve always and spend my time as prearranged by fate.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Although Sanskrit language has a special intelligence of its own, yet I also yearn for other languages; like although nectar is the intoxication in heaven, yet gods desire the intoxicated lips of the heavenly ladies.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “From grains ten times better is flour, from flour ten times better is milk, from milk eight times better is meat, from meat ten times better is ghee.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Sorrow increases disease, rice in sweetened milk increases body, ghee increases sperm, meat piling upon meat increases.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Generosity, sweet speech, patience, and knowledge of what is appropriate, cannot be gained by practice; these four are inborn qualities.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One who forsakes his own people and joins another group of people, himself causes his own destruction; like a king who destroys himself by forsaking his kingly duty to follow another duty.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A goad controls an elephant’s vast body, is the goad as vast as the elephant? A lamp when lighted banishes darkness, is the lamp as vast as the darkness? Struck by a thunderbolt a mountain is split apart, is the thunderbolt as vast as the mountain? No, in brilliance is might seated, what is there in mere vastness?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One engrossed in affairs of the home cannot gain knowledge, a meat-eater shows no mercy, a greedy materialist has no truth, a deceiving woman has no purity.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “An evil person will not become a saint, even if he is taught in several different ways; a Neem tree will not become sweet, even if it is watered by milk and ghee from its very top to its very roots.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The inner filthiness of an evil person cannot be washed away, even by hundred baths at a pilgrimage; just like an earthen pot of wine cannot be made clean, even if in fire it is truly heated.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Until the qualities of another person are known, one always devalues that another person; just like the wife of a hunter, not knowing the quality of a pearl obtained from the head of an elephant, throws it away in favour of a Gunja seed.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One who always consumes silently his meals for a whole year, resides in the heavenly world for one thousand crore years.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Lust, anger, greed, delicacies, ornamentations, nosiness, excessive sleep, and excessive service; for a student, these eight are forbidden.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One who lives by eating roots from unploughed fields, and fruits that have fallen on the ground, who always resides in forests, who daily performs the worship of the departed ancestors, such a Brahmin is known as a Rishi.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Whatever accumulated wealth is in surplus of their needs, good people donate it for good causes; Karna, Bali, Vikramaditya, these kings are even remembered today due to their charity; the honey-bees store up honey, and then some honey-collector takes all the accumulated honey away; neither did the honey-bees themselves enjoy their stored up honey, nor did they give it in charity; all they do now is rub both their legs in regret.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Competent among own people, kind with other people, wickedly-clever always towards evil people, loving towards good people, arrogant with base people, guileless with learned people, courageous against enemies, forgiving towards elders, and cunning with women; in these arts, that man who is skilful, in him the regard of the people is established.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In the company of saints an evil person becomes a saint, but a saint in the company of evil persons does not become evil; the scent of a flower is absorbed by the earth, but the scent of the earth is not absorbed by the flower.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Truth is mother, knowledge is father, righteousness is brother, kindness is friend, peace is wife, forgiveness is son, these six are my relatives.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Non-everlasting is the body, wealth is also not permanent, always together stays death; therefore, righteous acts do accumulate.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “To see one’s own mother in another man’s wife, to see useless pebbles in another man’s wealth, to see oneself in all beings of the world; one who sees thus, truly sees.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Knowledge is a friend in a journey, a wife is a friend in home, medicine is a friend in disease, and righteousness is a friend in death.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Courtesy from the sons of a king, good speech from a learned man, unrighteous behaviour from gamblers, and deceits from women, should be learnt.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One who spends recklessly, one who is an orphan, one who loves quarrels, and one who is eager for all kinds of women, such a man is swiftly destroyed.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Having no meal does not worry a learned person who has gained awareness, for righteousness alone is his worry; the food of every person is created at the time of the person’s birth.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In matters regarding the utilization of wealth and grains, in the accumulation of knowledge, and in eating a meal, the person who discards shyness, becomes happy.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A drop of water falling regularly fills up a pitcher; this is the objective of all knowledge, righteousness, and wealth.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Neither grieve for the past nor worry for the future; in the present time engage like a man of discernment.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “If the tree of life has given you the task of collecting leaves from the ground, do it blissfully. What you see as waste may be the compost that can help the fruits ripen early.”
Author: Shunya

quote: “Forkast det individ der giver sig til at kaste æg efter et hønsehus”
Author: Sofus Fabritius Christensen

quote: “Fremskidt er den eneste vej frem”
Author: Sofus Fabritius Christensen

quote: “If pleasure is desired then study has to be discarded, if study is desired then pleasure has to be discarded; how can the one enjoying pleasures undertake study? Where is the enjoyment of pleasures for the one who studies?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “O liberation desiring! Become aware and discard like poison the subject-object identification; drink the nectar of forgiveness, simplicity, mercy, purity, and truth.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The sensitive secrets that are known only between themselves, if spoken out by any of them, then that vile man destroys himself like a serpent straying in an anthill.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Fragrance in gold, fruit in sugarcane, flowers in sandalwood, a scholar with wealth, and a king with long life; these the Creator did not create; it seems like there were no advisors.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Among all medicines, nectar is foremost; among all material happiness, a hearty meal is foremost; among all sense organs, the eyes are foremost; and among all parts, the head is foremost.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A student, a servant, a traveller, a hungry person, a frightened person, a treasury guard, and a doorkeeper; these seven, if asleep, should be awakened.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A snake, a king, a wild beast, a stinging wasp, a child, someone else’s dog, and a fool; these seven, if asleep, should not be awakened.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Having half and incomplete study of the Veda, and having meals fit for a Shudra; that Brahmin what can he do? Without poison a mere snake.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Whose anger does not produce fear, whose satisfaction does not gift wealth, who cannot punish or help, if he is enraged, what can he do?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A poisonless snake should also greatly extend his hood; poison or no poison, the display of the enlarged hood itself is fearsome.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In poverty is patience seated, in a bad garment is appearing good seated, in bad food is heating seated, in ugliness is good manners seated.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One without wealth is not poor, wealthy he is decidedly; but one who is without the jewel of knowledge, is poor in all respects.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Without food, the kingdom burns; without Mantra, the priest; without charity, the patron; thus, there is no enemy like a Yagna.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Of what use is a birth in a high-status family for one who is without learning? Although born in a low-status family, the learned one is worshipped like a god.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Fact is never faith.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “A man decides his course in the circumstance.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Meat-eating, alcohol-drinking, foolish, unlearned, beastly men, are burdens whose weight the earth suffers.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A scholar is honoured by the people, a scholar is worshipped everywhere, a learned man enables everyone to profit, learning is everywhere worshipped.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “What cannot be seen by poets? What cannot be accomplished by women? What does a drunkard not tell? What does a crow not eat?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Fate makes a beggar a king, and a king a beggar; it makes a rich man into a poor man, and a poor man into a rich man.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The miser’s enemy is a beggar, the fool’s enemy is an intelligent man, the adulterous wife’s enemy is her husband, a thief’s enemy is the moon.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Those who have no learning, no penance, no charity, no knowledge, no good conduct, no virtue, and no righteousness; they are from the world of the dead and on the earth are simply a burden; in the form of humans, they roam around like deers.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “At the end, without a summarized essence an instruction cannot be given; being in the company of the Malaya Mountain does not make a bamboo tree a sandalwood tree.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One who does not possess his own awareness, what can scriptures do for him? One who is blind, what can a mirror do for him?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “To make a bad person into a good person, no solution exists on this earth; even if the anus is washed a hundred times, yet it does not become a superior organ.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Hating one’s own self results in death, hating others results in one’s loss of wealth, hating the king results in one’s annihilation, and hating a Brahmin results in the ruin of one’s family.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Better to live under a tree in a forest full of tigers and elephants, eat fruits and drink spring water, lie on the grass and wear torn barks of trees, than to stay in the midst of relatives, living a life without wealth.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A chariot should be left at a distance of five hands, a horse should be left at a distance of ten hands, an elephant should be left at a distance of a thousand hands, and an evil person should be left only after he is banished from the country.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A goad controls an elephant, a slap of the hand controls a horse, a stick controls horned beasts, and a hand holding a sword controls an evil person.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A Brahmin is satisfied at the time when eating a meal, a peacock is satisfied at the time when rain clouds thunder, a saint is satisfied at the time when others prosper, and an evil person is satisfied at the time when others suffer misery.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “By submitting placate a stronger enemy, by opposition subdue a weaker enemy, and with an enemy of equal strength, win over by politeness or military force.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In his heroic arms is a king’s strength; a Brahmin’s strength is in his knowledge of Brahma; in beauty, youth, and sweet speech, is a woman’s excellent strength.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Do not be very simple and upright, for going in the forest one sees that straight trees are cut down; whereas, crooked trees remain standing.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “When there is water, swans come and stay, and when the water dries up, they leave and go away; man should not behave likewise, and should not repeatedly leave and repeatedly seek shelter.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Spending accumulated wealth is its protection; just as letting out water protects a pond.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “When residents of heaven are born in this earth they have four marks: they give charity, they speak sweet words, they worship gods, and they give offerings to Brahmins.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “When residents of hell are born in this earth they have these marks: they are extremely vicious, they speak harsh words and are poor in speech, they have enmity with their own people, they associate with the base, and they serve disrespectful persons.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One goes, if, into a cave of a lion, then he may get pearls obtained from the elephant’s head; but if he goes into a hole of a jackal, then all he may find is a tail of a calf or a piece of a donkey’s skin.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The life of a man without learning is useless like the tail of a dog, which neither can hide the secret organs nor can it brush away insects.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Purity of speech, purity of mind, control of senses, and mercy for all, are the purities of one who gives counsel that benefits others.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In flower the fragrance, in sesamum seed the oil, in wood the fire, in milk the clarified butter, in sugarcane the jaggery; likewise in the body, seek the soul by discrimination.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The low seek only wealth, the middle seek wealth and respect, but the high seek only respect; because respect is the wealth of the high.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A lamp eats darkness and in the end, lamp black is produced; likewise, the type of food that is eaten, is reflected in the body, and always gets shown to the eyes of the public.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “After consuming sugarcane juice, milk, roots, betel leaves, fruits, and medicines, one should take a bath, give charity, and perform other acts.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Wealth give to the qualified, O wise one! And never to others; received ocean water from clouds as rain is always sweet; animate and inanimate, for all it renews the earth; and thereafter, a million times multiplied goes back to the ocean.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The base, a thousand of them, say wise men who know the essence, are equal to a single foreign invader; hence there is no one more base than a foreign invader.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In indigestion, if water is drunk, then water is a medicine; after food is digested, if water is drunk, then water gives strength to the body; if water is sipped in-between while eating, then water is nectar; if water is drunk at the end of a meal, then water is poison.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Knowledge is damaged because it is not applied; a man is helpless because he is ignorant; an army is damaged because there is no commander; and a woman is utterly ruined because she devalues, discards, and disgraces her husband.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The death of one’s wife when one is old; relatives controlling one’s wealth; and depending on others for one’s food; these three are disappointing dilemmas for a man.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “No fire offering is performed without the Veda; no charity is done without the act of giving; no feelings are felt without accomplishing anything; hence for all, love alone is the cause.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “No god resides in wood, nor in stone, nor in clay; in feeling only resides god, therefore feeling is the only reason.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “No greater austerity than maintaining peace, no greater happiness than contentment, no greater disease than thirst, and no greater religion than mercy.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Anger is Yama, king of death; thirst is Vaitarani, the river of hell; knowledge is Kamadughadhenu, the unending milk giving cow; and contentment is Nandan, the heaven’s garden.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Virtue ornaments beauty, conduct ornaments lineage, perfection ornaments knowledge, enjoyment ornaments wealth.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Lack of virtue tarnishes beauty, bad conduct tarnishes lineage, non-perfection tarnishes knowledge, improper utilization tarnishes wealth.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Water flowing under the ground is pure, a faithful wife is pure, a benefactor king is pure, a contented Brahmin is pure.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “An unsatisfied Brahmin is destroyed, a satisfied king is destroyed, a prostitute having shame is destroyed, and a shameless woman of a noble family is destroyed.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One who gave birth, one who girdles the sacred thread, one who teaches, one who provides food, and one who protects from fear, these five are your fathers, remember.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A king’s wife, a teacher’s wife, a friend’s wife, your wife’s mother, and your own mother, these five are your mothers, remember.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “By Shruti, righteousness is understood; by Shruti, evil thoughts are discarded; by Shruti, knowledge is acquired; by Shruti, liberation from human bondage is attained.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Among birds, the crow is degraded; among beasts, the dog; among ascetics, the sinner; and among all, one who criticizes others is degraded.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Ashes clean brass, copper by tamarind is cleaned, menstruation cleans a woman, a river by its speeding flow is cleaned.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The wandering king is worshipped, the wandering Brahmin is worshipped, the wandering Yogi is worshipped, but the wandering woman is utterly ruined.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Due to wealth a man has friends, due to wealth a man has relatives, due to wealth he alone is called as a man of men, and due to wealth he is respected as a highly learned man.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “As the vision is, so goes the brain, so is the occupation envisioned, so are the helpers, so is the visionary’s competency.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Time digests earthly beings, time kills the population, time remains awake when all sleep, time alone is of farthest going.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One blind by birth cannot see the faults, one blinded by lust cannot see the faults, one maddened by pride cannot see the faults, one who is rich cannot see the faults.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The soul oneself performs actions, oneself bears its fruits, oneself roams the world, oneself frees from it.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The king suffers the sins created by the kingdom, the priest suffers the sins created by the king, the husband suffers the sins created by the wife, the Guru suffers the sins created by the disciple.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A debt-creating father is an enemy, an adulteress mother is an enemy, a beautiful wife is an enemy, an uneducated son is an enemy.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The greedy is won over by wealth, the egoist is won over by showing respect, the fool is won over by fooling as per his liking, the learned is won over by telling the truth.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Better to have no kingdom than to have a badly ruled kingdom, better to have no friends than to have bad friends, better to have no disciple than to have a bad disciple, better to have no wife than to have a bad wife.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In a kingdom ruled by an evil king, how can the subjects be happy? In a bad friend’s friendship, how can one be at peace? With an evil wife, how can there be love in a home? By teaching a bad disciple, how can one gain renown?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One from the lion, one from the crane, four from the cock, five from the crow, six from the dog, and three from the donkey.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Big or small, if the work is worth doing, then by giving everything it should begin and be immediately done; the lion displays this one quality.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Keeping senses under control like a crane, the wise man, the knower of the place, time, and strength, successfully accomplishes all tasks.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Keeping senses under control, devoid of anger and hate, remaining composed equally in sorrow and happiness, peaceful knower of the essence, is a saintly accomplishment.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “To wake up at the exact time, to be aggressive in a fight, to distribute gains fairly among relations, and to earn one’s food by personal exertion, these four qualities should be learnt from a cock.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “To have sexual intercourse in privacy, to remain aware every moment, to store items effectively, to remain cautious, and to not trust anyone, these five qualities should be learnt from a crow.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “To possess a great appetite, to remain content with little food, to enjoy deep slumber, to wake up instantly at the slightest noise, to be totally devoted to one’s master, and to be brave, these six qualities should be learnt from a dog.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Being extremely tired yet to go on carrying the load, paying no attention to cold or heat, and to remain always content, these three qualities should be learnt from a donkey.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “An intelligent man should not reveal his loss of wealth, his mental vexation, his having an adulterous wife, his being insulted by others, and his disgrace at the hands of others.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In matters of money, in usage of food items, in accumulation of knowledge, in eating, and in behaviour, one who discards shyness, becomes happy.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Those who are satiated with the nectar of contentment, experience such happiness and peace, which cannot be experienced by persons who out of greed for wealth, run around here and there.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One should remain content with one’s own wife, self-earned food and wealth; but one should not remain content in these three: learning, chanting the name of God, and charity.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Do not pass between two Brahmins; a Brahmin and a sacrificial fire; a husband and a wife; an employer and his employee; a plough and an ox.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Do not let your feet touch fire, a Guru, or a Brahmin, and it also should not touch a cow, a virgin girl, an aged person, or a child.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Alone for performing austerities, two for studying, three for singing, four for journey, five for agriculture, and many for war.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “She is a wife who is pure and competent, she is a wife who remains faithful to her husband, she is a wife whom the husband loves, she is a wife who speaks truthfully.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Without a son, a house is empty; directions are empty without relations; a fool’s heart is empty; absolutely empty is poverty.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Without its application, knowledge is poison; in stomach troubles, food is poison; in poverty, a social gathering is poison; in old age, a young woman is poison.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Discard the religion that shows no mercy, discard the Guru who is without knowledge, discard the wife who has an angry mouth, discard the relative who has no affection.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Travel ages the body, mountains by water are aged, lack of sexual intercourse ages a woman, clothes by heat are aged.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “By keeping senses under his control, a learned man, the knower of the strengths of place and time, with his speech, can accomplish all types of work.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “What to do at which time? Who is a friend? What type of a place is this? What is income and what is expense? What am I? What are my strengths and weaknesses? Deeply think again and again.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Fire is the god for the Brahmin; the heart is the god for the devotee; the idol is the god for the less intelligent; everywhere is god for one who sees equality.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The fire is the Guru for the twice-born; for all colours, the Brahmin is the Guru; the husband is the Guru for the wife; and for all, the guest is the Guru.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “By four ways is gold tested: rubbing, cutting, heating, and beating; likewise, by four ways is a man tested: his renunciation, his behaviour, his qualities, and his actions.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The fearful may be feared, until it has not arrived; once it arrives, from all sides attack it doubtlessly.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Born from the same womb and under the same constellation, yet do not become alike in character; likewise, the Badari tree’s thorns.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The renunciate is no authority on worldly matters, the non-lecherous does not love decorating himself, the non-expert cannot speak delightfully, the outspoken is not competent as a crook.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The fool envies the learned, the poor envies the rich, the kept-woman envies the family woman, the widow envies the married.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “By laziness, the usefulness of knowledge is damaged; by others controlling one’s own wealth, the convenience of wealth is damaged; by sowing little seed, the field is damaged; by having no commander, the army is damaged.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Practice reveals knowledge, conduct reveals lineage, qualities reveal virtue, eyes reveal anger.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Wealth protects religion, application protects knowledge, gentleness protects a king, a good woman protects a home.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Unnecessarily disrespecting the knowledge of the Vedas, unnecessarily devaluing the expertise of the Shastras, unnecessarily deriding men of peaceful disposition; such people come to sorrow unnecessarily.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Charity destroys poverty, righteous conduct destroys misery, awareness destroys ignorance, feeling destroys fear.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “No disease like lust, no enemy like attachment, no fire like anger, no happiness like highest knowledge.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Birth and death are faced alone, reaped alone are good and bad deeds, to hell descends one alone, alone one ascends to the highest heaven.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Insignificant is heaven to knowers of Brahma, insignificant is life to the brave, insignificant are women to the conqueror of senses, insignificant is the world to the unattached.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Knowledge is a friend during a journey, a wife is a friend in the house, medicine is a friend in sickness, righteousness is a friend in death.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Useless is rain to the sea, useless is food to the satiated, useless is a donation to the rich, and useless is a lamp to the sun.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “No water like rainwater, no strength like Atma, no light like eyes, and no beloved like food.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The poor desire wealth, the four-footed desire speech, humans desire heaven, and the gods desire liberation.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Truth supports the earth, truth heats the sun, truth blows the wind, everything on truth is established.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Moving is Lakshmi, and the moving Prana also moves from one alive temple to another, in this moving-unmoving world, Dharma alone is unmoving.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Among men, the barber is cunning; among birds, the crow; among the four-footed, the jackal; among women, cunning is the flower-girl.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “For a daughter, marriage in a good family should be arranged; for a son, a sound education should be arranged; for an enemy, addictions should be arranged; for a friend, righteous works should be arranged.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Between an evil person and a snake, a snake is better and not an evil person; for a snake strikes only when it is fated, but an evil person strikes at every step.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The reason why kings gather around themselves persons of noble lineage, is because such persons do not leave the king in the beginning, middle, or the end.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “At the time of destruction, the oceans transgress their limits and seek to come apart, but even at that time, a saint neither transgresses his limits nor does he come apart.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A fool should be kept afar, for he is a mere two-legged beast, whose inappropriate sharp words pierces like an unseen thorn.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “With beauty and youth endowed, and in a large high-status family born, yet men without education are not befitting, just like a fragrantless Kinshuka flower.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A cuckoo’s musical notes, is its beauty; a woman’s beauty is in her remaining faithful to her husband; knowledge is the beauty of an ugly person; forgiveness is the beauty of a saint.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Discard one for the sake of the family; for the sake of the village, discard the family; discard the village for the sake of the country; for the sake of the Atma, discard the world.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Economic activity removes poverty, chanting removes sins, silence removes quarrels, alertness removes fear.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Due to her extreme beauty, Sita was abducted; due to his extreme pride, Ravana was killed; due to his extreme charity, Bali was bounded; therefore extreme in everything, should be debarred.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “What is heavy for the capable? What is distant for the businessperson? What is foreign for the knowledgeable? Who is a stranger for the delightful speaker?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A single good tree with flowers fragrant, perfumes the forest entirely; a good son to his family does likewise.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A single dry tree burning with fire, burns the forest entirely; a bad son to his family does likewise.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A single good son, knowledgeable and well-behaved, delights the family entirely; like the moon delights the night.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Of what use are many sons who only cause sorrow and exasperation? Better to have a single son in whom the family finds restful peace.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Pamper a son upto five years; ten years thereafter use punishment; upon his attaining the sixteenth year, treat him like a friend.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “From uprisings, from someone else’s doings, from famine, from a fearful surrounding, and from the contact of wicked persons, one who runs away, remains alive.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The person who refrains from Dharma, Artha, Kama, Moksha, takes birth after birth only to die; since for him the fruit of being born, is death only.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Where fools are not worshipped, where grain is amply stored, where there is no quarrel between husband and wife, there, Śrī, the goddess of wealth, herself comes on her own.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Life-span, work, wealth, knowledge, and time of death, these five are formed in the womb alongwith the body.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Mixing with saints is hindered due to sons, friends, and relatives; but those who mix with them gain righteousness, and in a good manner are able to form their families.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Sight, attention, and touch, are used by fish, tortoises, and birds, to always bring up their young ones; likewise is the association of virtuous persons.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “When the body is healthy and death is far, one should work for the benefit of the soul, for at life’s end, what can be done?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Like Kamadhenu is knowledge; in crisis it is fruitful; in journeys like a mother it offers good advice; knowledge is hidden treasure, remember.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A single son with good qualities is enough, without qualities a hundred are of what use? A single moon dispels darkness, not the stars in thousands.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Better to die immediately upon birth, than to live a long life as a fool; one who dies as soon as he is born, suffers little grief, whereas the fool as long as he lives, goes on burning.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Residing in a bad city, serving a person of a low-status family, bad food, an angry-mouthed wife, a foolish son, and a widowed daughter; these six without fire burn the body.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “What to do with a cow who neither gives milk nor becomes pregnant? Of what use is a son who is neither learned nor devoted?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “From the heat of the worldly fires, these three provide relief: a worthy son, a loving wife, and company of the truthful.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Only once is uttered the command by the king, only once are words spoken by the learned, only once is a daughter given in marriage, these three are done only once.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Do not get established in a place that is not frequented by people, where people have no fear, no shame, no competency, and no sacrificing ability.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Know the true nature of servants by putting them at work, of a relative when one is suffering a calamity, of a friend when one is facing an adversity, and of a wife when one’s wealth is lost.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “In need, in addiction, in receiving, in famine, in danger from enemies, in the royal court, in the crematorium, one who does not forsake, is a relative.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One who discards certainty in favour of uncertainty; certainly destroys certainty; and uncertainty is destroyed as it is.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “An intelligent man does not like an ugly woman, even if she belongs to a high-status family, and also does not like a woman from a low-status family, even if she is beautiful; thus, marriage among equal status is prescribed.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Rivers, armed men, clawed and horned beasts, should not be trusted, including women, and members of the royal family.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Even in poison, nectar can be found; in filth, gold; in an enemy, good characteristics; and in a child, words of wisdom.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Women eat two-times more food, are four-times more shy, have six-times more courage, and have eight-times more lust; so it is remembered.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Unrighteous courage, deceitful tactics, foolishness, greed, filthiness, and cruelty, are natural faults of women.”
Author: Rajen Jani

quote: “To have food and the strength to consume it; to have a woman and the strength to ravish her; to have prosperity and the strength to give charity; these are not results of small austerities.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “One whose son is obedient, whose wife behaves according to his wishes, and who is content with his prosperity and fame, his heaven is here only.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “He is a son who is a devotee of his father, he is a father who provides sustenance, he is a friend in whom one can confide, she is a wife from whom contentment is obtained.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Ruining your work behind your back, but talking sweetly in front of you, such a person is a duplicity-practising friend, who is like a pot containing poison, but has a layer of milk on top.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Do not trust a duplicity-practising friend, and also trust not a friend; for if the friend becomes angry, then all secrets he will reveal.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A work whose details are mentally worked out, should not be revealed in words; with a strategy it should be protected, so that secretly the work can be arranged.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Painful is indeed foolishness, painful is indeed youth, but painfully painful is residing in another person’s house.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A jewel is not found in every mountain, a pearl is not found on the head of every elephant, good people are not found everywhere, sandalwood is not found in every forest.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The wise always teach their sons various skills, for a son who is versed in strategy and is also skilled, then he makes his family worshipable.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “That mother is an enemy and that father is a foe, who do not educate their children; for in the midst of a public assembly, uneducated children are a sore sight, just like cranes in the midst of swans.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Over-indulgence has many faults, punishment has many virtues; therefore, a son and a pupil should be punished and not over-indulged.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A verse, or its half, or its half’s half, or just a letter, should be studied; for without charity, without study, without virtuous action, a day should not pass.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Sorrow of separation from one’s beloved, dishonour from one’s own people, exhaustion of money taken as a loan, serving a wicked person, and friends becoming two-faced in one’s poverty; these five without fire burn the body.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Trees on the banks of a river, a lustful woman in another man’s house, and a king without strategists, are swiftly destroyed, without doubt.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “The strength of a Brahmin is his knowledge, the Kshatriya ruler’s strength is his army, the strength of a Vaishya is his wealth, a Shudra’s strength is his service.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “A poor man is left by a prostitute; the subjects leave a weak king; a bird leaves a fruitless tree; after meals, the guests leave the house.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “After receiving fees, the Brahmin leaves the patron; after receiving education, the student leaves the Guru; burned forests are left by the deer.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “By becoming friends with a person of evil action, or a person of evil vision, or a person of evil residence, or a person of evil reputation, one is swiftly ruined.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Among equals, befitting is love; a king’s service is befitting; seriousness is befitting in behaviour; an extremely beautiful woman is befitting in a home.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Whose family is without faults? Whom has illness not pained? Who has not received some kind of addiction? Who is happy forever?”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Behaviour shows the family, speech shows the country, mutual respect shows the love, the body shows the food.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “How do you escape the pain;you must pray for grace to persevere in a spirit of eternal patience in the face of suffering.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Your difficulties are your deliverance from spiritual deadness.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Decide what's more important to you: the dream that your desired outcome, or your fear ... As long as you stay focused on the dream, you'll see opportunities. But if you let the fear take over, all you'll ever see is obstacles.”
Author: Nancy Naigle,

quote: “Thank God for the blessings of today.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Through many trials, a man will know himself.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Life is like a big cave with numerous doors. Only there's mist around our eyes, and we can't see them.
Author: Neelam Saxena Chandra

quote: “The men who try to do something and fail are infinitely better than those who try to do nothing and succeed.”
Author: Laeeq Peeran

quote: “The Maker is a miracle working awe God.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “What a wonder wonderful God we serve!”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “There is nothing like the word of God.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “There is nothing that makes man happy than his hope.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “What you want is within your reach”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “The special privilege is to pray.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Suffering should make a man submit to God.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “The future rewards the humility of "learn it all"s and punishes the hubris of "know it all"s.”
Author: Maulik Parekh,

quote: “The people want to know what you stand for before they stand with you.”
Author: Maulik Parekh,

quote: “It's no longer about where you go in the world to explore the opportunities. It's about how you explore the world of opportunities from where you are.”
Author: Maulik Parekh,

quote: “Unshakable faith and unbreakable commitment are the virtues of a champion.”
Author: Sharat Sharma,

quote: “Difficulty is a part to discovery.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “What we do matters because this is the moment to fulfil our duty.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Every experience gives it's unique education.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “মৃত্যু অনিবার্য তাকে ভালোবাসাটাই শ্রেয়। যদি তাকে আমি ভয় পাই তাহলে আমি মুর্খ। যে ব্যাক্তি অনিবার্যকে গ্রহন করে আনন্দ উপভোগ করতে পারে সে ই প্রকৃত অর্থে শিক্ষিত এবং জ্ঞানি।”
Author: G.K. Dutta

quote: “প্রতিপক্ষকে কখনো দুর্বল ভাবতে নেই, প্রতিটা পদক্ষেপ মুল্যবান। প্রস্তুতি কখনোই পর্যাপ্ত হয় না। তাই যতটা সম্ভব প্রস্তুত হওয়া প্রয়োজন তাতে পরাজয়ের আশঙ্কা কম থাকে।”
Author: G.K. Dutta

quote: “The faith of prayer is a persistent fire.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita,

quote: “By imparting learning to a foolish disciple, by maintaining an evil woman, and by associating with the miserable, even a learned man comes to disgrace.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Having an evil wife, a false friend, and an argumentative servant, is like living in a house with snakes that brings only death, without any doubt.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “For times of crisis, wealth should be protected; women should be protected more than wealth; the own self constantly should be protected more than women and more than wealth.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “For times of crisis, wealth should be protected by keeping it undisclosed hidden away, meant to be used only in crisis; for perhaps the unsteady Lakshmi, the goddess of wealth, may destroy all accumulated disclosed wealth.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Do not live in a country where there is no respect, no livelihood, no relatives, and no scope of learning.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “Do not spend even a single day where there are no wealthy persons, no Shrauta mantra knowing Brahmins, no king, no river, and no physician.”
Author: Rajen Jani,

quote: “When we mentally give a person, place, or point in time more credit than ourselves, we create a fictitious ceiling. A restriction over the expectations that we have over our own performance in that moment. We get tense. We focus on the outcome instead of the activity and we miss the doing of the deed. We either think the world depends on the result or it's too good to be true. But it doesn't and it isn't. And it's not our right to believe it does or is.
Author: Matthew McConaughey,

quote: “What does it mean to be self aware? In a sense, it's what it sounds like, but it also goes deeper than that. Self awareness is awareness that goes beyond the surface of the self; it's becoming aware not just of who we are, but what we stand for, and all the little things that make us up. When you become self aware, you learn about what makes you tick. You delve into the experiences that make you up as well as your thought patterns, perspectives, predominant emotions, and overarching beliefs. Self awareness without judgement is the key to a deep understanding of oneself, and the beginning of the healing process. Becoming self aware helps us to better understand our wants and needs, and only then can we move forward in taking care of ourself the right way, meeting our needs, and being secure enough in ourselves to go after our dreams.”
Author: LeeNor Dikel,

quote: “Although we all wish there was, there really is no overnight recipe for success; instead, you need to know who you are to know what you want, and within that process of self discovery and self care you develop the clarity and drive to get to where you need to be.”
Author: LeeNor Dikel,

quote: “Choose a different perspective to change how you see things - the word "NO" turned upside-down becomes "ON”
Author: Íeda Jónasdóttir Herman,

quote: “We can't live like chickens in a coop and expect to be able to soar the skies like seagulls”
Author: Íeda Jónasdóttir Herman,

quote: “My grandfather's early training and admonition that 'Viking kids don't cry' has helped me to have courage and a strong will. Some call it foolhardy and stubborn but it has served me well.”
Author: Íeda Jónasdóttir Herman,

quote: “Life is for labour.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Be patience in the face of suffering. Pray for strength to preserve in spirit of endured pain.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Be patience in suffering. Pray for strength to endured the pain.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Do not cry that that there is no one to help you. Call on Christ to save you in any situation.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “What matter most is not the fall but your ability to rise whenever you fall.”

quote: “If we need help, we must pray to God to gives us helper, the Holy Spirit.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Human potential is incomputable.”
Author: Abhijit Naskar,

quote: “The battles I’ve conquered,
Author: Samiha Totanji

quote: “I am far too busy enjoying life to be limited by acting my age”
Author: Íeda Jónasdóttir Herman,

quote: “Attitude is everything - choose to believe”

quote: “There is nothing better than the Word of God.”

quote: “At end of your life, God will ask you what you did with the life he gave you.”

quote: “Be careful, doubt can destroy you.”

quote: “You have to find you way in this world.”

quote: “You owe it yourself to be your best self.”

quote: “A man must live for a cause higher than himself, this is the courage of his existence.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “The goal is to keep going.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “There is no home like to live in the sacredness of your heart.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Do God has implemented in your heart.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “There is no great miracle like this moment.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “There is no mystery like the moment of death.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Life teaches it's own lessons in the moment of time.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “If you know the worth of well being, you will work with the strength God has given you.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Every living being is given the gracious gift of breath.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Every living being is given the opportunity to live life.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Your life is your responsibility.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Having someone who believes in you makes a lot of difference. They don't have to make speeches. Just believing is usually enough.”
Author: Stephen King,

quote: “Trial is a test.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “The best remedy is repentance.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “All men were born brothers, this is the beauty of being.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “To rebel is to reject God.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “The wonder God wait to be wanted.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “You can only succeed through a steady persistent effort .”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Any achievement depends on diligence of the desire.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “Word power is world power.”
Author: Maahi Shah

quote: “A man his motivated by his mission.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “In school, they taught us a "hero" never follows the "herd". Twenty years of being a misfit and I finally realised that maybe, the hero never had a choice. Maybe, a hero was just a reject from the herd.”
Author: Ayushee Ghoshal

quote: “Big is the same as small. There's just more of it.”
Author: Richard Osman,

quote: “Let Happiness be the New Perfect!”

quote: “Whoever has faith, fears no defeat, for this is the energy that fuels determination to keep going forward until the goal is achieved.”

quote: “A true servant lives for a cause higher than normal life.”

quote: “The question is what are you doing with the life God gave you?”

quote: “There is glory in being youthful.”

quote: “Where there is faith, there is no fear.”

quote: “What a man is lies within his spirit displayed by his actions.”

quote: “There is only one Saviour who can save you from your sins, the Lord Jesus Chris.”

quote: “There is only one Saviour who can save you from your sins, the Lord Jesus Christ.”

quote: “There is only one Saviour, the Lord Jesus Christ, who can save you from your sins.”

quote: “Faith is obedience to the faithful God.”

quote: “Do not fear defeat nor death.”

quote: “If speed limit or fear of mishap were not there to pull you back, driving fast would be a feelingless act. If there were no force to pull you back, you would get no feeling in moving ahead.”

quote: “Don't let your imperfection of yesterday be your inheritance of the future. There's more optimistic of ceasefire in the coming epoch than breathing in the prevailing years of mental despondency and discomposure.”
Author: Daniel Linn Lewis

quote: “People will either do what is right, or what suits them. The two concepts are often mutually exclusive. One is selfless, the other, typically, is self-serving.”

quote: “Life is the biggest match we will ever play, and only we can win or lose depending on the quality of our game.”
Author: Luigino Bottega,

quote: “Each of us is called to create harmony and a better life for ourselves, others and the cosmos, expressing love.”
Author: Luigino Bottega,

quote: “Success is the ability to imagine and create a better future for ourselves, others and the cosmos.”
Author: Luigino Bottega,

quote: “No one experiences the same trouble twice.”
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: “There are points in life at which we no longer have anything to lose. When we live in those times, we have a dangerous freedom.”
Author: Chaker Khazaal,

quote: “It is hopelessness and desperation that can sometimes lead to liberation. Imagine what is possible when the choice is between survival and the dreaded alternative.”
Author: Chaker Khazaal,

quote: “These are two sides of the winning coin.”
Author: Chaker Khazaal,

quote: “Without endeavour, there is no experience.”

quote: “Only at limit of man can he rise above his own strength to behold the divine power only if he desire seek.”

quote: “Man can find the might of his Maker if he desire seek him.”

quote: “You are not poor. You have a heart and a brain. That's enough to start.”

quote: “The Maker alone is merciful.”

quote: “Who are we if not for the sum of what inspires us?”

quote: “Love seeks light, not darkness.”

quote: “Our on-demand world socializes us to desire instantaneous wish fulfillment. But that’s not how the world really works. Anything that is truly meaningful and fulfilling happens over time with consistent effort.”

quote: “In order for us to feel like we have the time, energy, money, and space to create the lives we really want to live, we need to create and enforce healthy boundaries that enable us to experience a sense of balance. From this open space, we can truly bloom.”

quote: “The quality of our lives could be dramatically improved by letting go of superfluous items, thoughts, people, and obligations that no longer fit the life we want to live or the person we’re becoming.”

quote: “Your life is so precious. Don’t waste it seeking other people’s approval or permission to pursue your dreams.”

quote: “The better we become about determining our top priorities and setting boundaries to protect them, the greater potential we’ll have for achieving our dreams.”

quote: “If you know that you’re meant to change something in your life, get to work changing it. Get so busy doing the “right” things that you don’t have time to do the “wrong” things anymore.”

quote: “Friends who don’t care about your feelings aren’t your real friends.”

quote: “When we let go of concern or worry about what others think about us, we free ourselves to be the weird and wonderful people we were born to be.”

quote: “A lesson any writer can use. Don’t be afraid. That simple; don’t let them scare you. There’s nothing they can do to you. If they kick you out of films, do TV. If they kick you out of TV, write novels. If they won’t buy your novels, sell short stories. Can’t do that, then take a job as a bricklayer. A writer always writes. That’s what he’s for. And if they won’t let you write one kind of thing, if they chop you off at the pockets in the market place, then go to another market place. And if they close of all the bazaars, then by God go and work with your hands till you can write, because the talent is always there. But the first time you say, “Oh, Christ, they’ll kill me!” then you’re done. Because the chief commodity a writer has to sell is his courage. And if he has none, he is more than a coward. He is a sellout and a fink and a heretic, because writing is a holy chore.”
Author: Harlan Ellison,
